item.title: Allison add a quote by Kathy Davis
item.description: "A hundred years from now it will not matter what my bank account was, the sort of house I lived in, or the kind of car I drove . . . . but the world maybe different because I was important in the life of a child." -- Kathy Davis

item.title: Allison add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Allison add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "In the long run, we shape our lives, and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our own responsibility." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Allison add a quote by Stephen R. Covey
item.description: "But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise." -- Stephen R. Covey

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ann Landers
item.description: "Expect trouble as an inevitable part of life and when it comes hold your head high look it squarely in the eye and say “I will be bigger then you. You cannot defeat me" -- Ann Landers

item.title: Allison add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Allison add a quote by Robert Veninga
item.description: "Human pain does not let go of its grip at one point in time. Rather it works its way out of our consciousness over time. There is a season of sadness. A season of tranquility. A season of hope." -- Robert Veninga

item.title: Allison add a quote by Olga Ilyin
item.description: "It has been my repeated experience that when you say to life calmly and firmly….”I trust you; do what you must,” life had an uncanny way of responding to your need. - " -- Olga Ilyin

item.title: Allison add a quote by Alexander holmbolt
item.description: "I am more and more convinced that our happiness or unhappiness depends more on the way we meet events of life than on the nature of those events themselves." -- Alexander holmbolt

item.title: Allison add a quote by Olden Nash
item.description: "No you never get any fun Out of things you haven’t done." -- Olden Nash

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by aJoyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I used to think getting old was about vanity but, actually it’s about losing people you love. Joyce Carol Oates " -- aJoyce Carol Oates

item.title: Allison add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Allison add a quote by - Victor Hugo
item.description: "Peace is happiness digesting." -- - Victor Hugo

item.title: Allison add a quote by Dag Hammarskjold
item.description: "Life only demands from you the strength you possess." -- Dag Hammarskjold

item.title: Allison add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Reflect upon your present blessings -- of which every man has many -- not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Allison add a quote by Michael McLean
item.description: "All I ever wanted...couldn t hold a candle to what I ve been given." -- Michael McLean

item.title: Allison add a quote by Lin Yutang
item.description: "If you can spend a perfectly useless afternoon in a perfectly useless manner, you have learned how to live" -- Lin Yutang

item.title: Allison add a quote by Rhonda Hansome
item.description: "A man s got to do what a man s got to do. A woman must do what he can t. " -- Rhonda Hansome

item.title: Allison add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "When you are a Bear of Very Little Brain, and you Think of Things, you find sometimes that a Thing which seemed very Thingish inside you is quite different when it gets out into the open and has other people looking at it." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Rivers know this there is no hurry. We shall get there some day. " -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Allison add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Allison add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Allison add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gate And though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when I Shall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Allison add a quote by Ralph Fiennes
item.description: "Success...Is all about being able to extend love to people...not in a big capital-letter sense but in the everyday; little by little, task by task, gesture by gesture, word by word" -- Ralph Fiennes

item.title: Allison add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
